perturbation.original_text:
THIS TRADEMARK LICENSE AGREEMENT (this “Agreement”), made and entered into as of the [ ] day of [ ], 2020 (the “Effective
Date”), by and between ARCONIC INC., a corporation organized under the laws of Delaware (“Licensee”) and ARCONIC ROLLED PRODUCTS
CORP., a corporation organized under the laws of Delaware (“Licensor”).
perturbation.changed_text:
THIS TRADEMARK LICENSE AGREEMENT (this “Agreement”), made and entered into as of the [ ] day of [ ], 2020 (the “Effective
Date”), by and between ARCONIC INC., a corporation organized under the laws of Delaware (“Recipient”) and ARCONIC ROLLED PRODUCTS
CORP., a corporation organized under the laws of Delaware (“Provider”).
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Licensee' and 'Licensor' are replaced with 'Recipient' and 'Provider' respectively. This creates confusion as the rest of the document refers to 'Licensee' and 'Licensor', making it unclear which entity holds the rights and obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
1. GRANT AND SCOPE OF LICENSE.
1.1 Grant of License. Licensor on behalf of itself and its Affliates hereby grants to Licensee the limited licenses to use and have used the
Licensed Mark: (i) for the Licensed Products as set forth on Schedule 2; and (ii) as set forth on Schedule 1, concerning agreements entered into by
Licensee prior to the Effective Date (“Existing Agreements”).
perturbation.changed_text:
1. GRANT AND SCOPE OF LICENSE.
1.1 Grant of License. Provider on behalf of itself and its Affliates hereby grants to Customer the limited licenses to use and have used the
Licensed Mark: (i) for the Licensed Products as set forth on Schedule 2; and (ii) as set forth on Schedule 1, concerning agreements entered into by
Customer prior to the Effective Date (“Existing Agreements”).
perturbation.explanation: Here, the term 'Licensor' is changed to 'Provider' and 'Licensee' is changed to 'Customer'. Given the preamble has already established 'Licensor' and 'Licensee', this shift introduces conflict and uncertainty about who is granting and receiving the license.

perturbation.original_text:
3. INDEMNIFICATION.
Licensee shall defend, indemnify and hold harmless Licensor and its officers, directors, employees, agents, corporate subsidiaries, parents,
and affiliates (“Licensor Indemnitees”) from and against any and all demands, claims, actions or causes of action, assessments, deficiencies,
damages, losses, liabilities and expenses (including, without limitation, reasonable expenses of investigation and attorneys’ fees and expenses),
incurred in conjunction with or arising out of or relating to any third-party claim concerning the Licensed Products and any acts or omissions of
Licensee with respect to the Licensed Mark, including without limitation Licensee’s performance of its obligations under this Agreement. The
Licensor Indemnitees agree to cooperate with Licensee, at Licensee’s expense, to provide copies of any documents or materials reasonably
requested by Licensee in support of its defense of the Licensor Indemnitees.
perturbation.changed_text:
3. INDEMNIFICATION.
Recipient shall defend, indemnify and hold harmless Provider and its officers, directors, employees, agents, corporate subsidiaries, parents,
and affiliates (“Licensor Indemnitees”) from and against any and all demands, claims, actions or causes of action, assessments, deficiencies,
damages, losses, liabilities and expenses (including, without limitation, reasonable expenses of investigation and attorneys’ fees and expenses),
incurred in conjunction with or arising out of or relating to any third-party claim concerning the Licensed Products and any acts or omissions of
Recipient with respect to the Licensed Mark, including without limitation Recipient’s performance of its obligations under this Agreement. The
Licensor Indemnitees agree to cooperate with Recipient, at Recipient’s expense, to provide copies of any documents or materials reasonably
requested by Recipient in support of its defense of the Licensor Indemnitees.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Licensee' and 'Licensor' are replaced with 'Recipient' and 'Provider' respectively. This creates further contradiction, as the text still refers to "Licensor Indemnitees," creating confusion about who exactly is being indemnified.
